𓐝 𓐛 mere mǣre (border, part) 𓌻 𒈥 𒈦 𓐝 𓐛 meso medi "half" ½ 1/2 𓌻 𒈥 𒈦

at least three different/possible/hypothized readings:

  1. m < wem? 𓐝 ⋍ 𓐙 𓅓𓏶 amber-bird
  2. v < who? whom? < wer,wen,wem? 𓐝𓂝 < phr / brt part 𓅓𓐝
  3. c < qui? … com/cul/cur? 𓐛 𓏶 side shape ship 𓐝 𓊛 1+2+3:embarka𓊛

synthesis 𓐝 qvam ?

𓐝 𓏤 | form, shape
𓐛 𓏤 | side, border (of land), half, half-aroura

mere mǣre

𓐛 𓏤 | side, border (of land), half, half-aroura
𓇥𓂋 gemære ġemǣru "limit, border" *gamairiją ġe-mǣre mǣre boundary, border <> 𓈗 mare <> mere part

The M/Ç confustion of 𓌸 ≠ 𓌻 is similar to 𓐛 ≠ 𓐝
𓌻 𓂋 𓂋 𓏏 𓉕 𓉐 marroad/street:
𓐝 𓂝 𓏏 𓈖 𓌙 𓈐 𓂻 road | 𓐝roaden
𓐛 𓊃 𓏏 𓂻 | course | ⇔ march

road
𓐝roaden 𓐝 𓂝 𓏏 𓈖 𓌙 𓈐 𓂻 ⇔
cardan 𓐝 𓂝 𓏏 𓈖 𓌙 𓈐 𓂻 ⇔ course 𓊖 camina cammīnus “way” 𓐛 𓊃 𓏏 𓂻 | course | ⇔ march
mardan 𓐝 𓂝 𓏏 𓈖 𓌙 𓈐 𓂻 ⇔ 𒈱 𒋞 MURGU ⇔ 𓅓 𓍿 𓃒 मार्ग mārga
broadon 𓐝 𓂝 𓏏 𓈖 𓌙 𓈐 𓂻 ⇔ platon पथ path ⇔
fahrdan 𓐝 𓂝 𓏏 𓈖 𓌙 𓈐 𓂻 ⇔ ways viaduct Fahrᵗbahn

The most supported variant above is
maroad 𓌻 𓂋 𓂋 𓏏 𓉕 𓉐 street: > malu 马路 morou 陌禸街 vs drome reversed
